text: Hello all, im trying to find a way to systematically replicate a workflow from one account to multiple accounts. The export function only creates a png version of it so at the moment im stuck having to do it manually wich is too time consuming. Any ideas?
Currently this isn't possible, what you can do though is create behavioral events and have those trigger workflows
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/analytics/events>
You can use the API to do this (it would take a pretty good amount of setup though) but it will only work on contact based workflows

How would you go about building a module or an editable area of a page that never needs to be used again? Modules are re-usable but this just needs to be an editable section. Can you point me to the right guide if there is one?
Wrong channel, <#CFPRTEGTX|modules> would be the best place to post
You'll definitely want to built out the action using something like postman where you can quickly iterate through different things. I've found that the SDK can be super inaccurate for certain things
Your outputs looks correct do you possibly have the full action request?
If so I can run that through a quick test
I haven't use the endpoints since the SDK seemed nice. Yeah, give me one second.
This will work for you
don't worry about the 1-29170588 thing
Okay so I should just not use the sdk for this?
I wouldn't, I would just post it using the actions endpoint
`<https://api.hubapi.com/automation/v4/actions>`
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/workflows/custom-code-actions>
okay sounds good, thank you for the help!
of course
